1.name: Stench
1.desc: By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.

2.name: Drizzle
2.desc: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.

3.name: Speed Boost
3.desc: Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.

4.name: Battle Armor
4.desc: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

5.name: Sturdy
5.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

6.name: Damp
6.desc: Prevents the use of explosive moves such as Self-Destruct by dampening its surroundings.

7.name: Limber
7.desc: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.

8.name: Sand Veil
8.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's evasion in a sandstorm.

9.name: Static
9.desc: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.

10.name: Volt Absorb
10.desc: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move, instead of taking damage.

11.name: Water Absorb
11.desc: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move, instead of taking damage.

12.name: Oblivious
12.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

14.name: Compound Eyes
14.desc: The Pokémon's compound eyes boost its accuracy.

15.name: Insomnia
15.desc: The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.

16.name: Color Change
16.desc: The Pokémon's type becomes the type of the move used on it.

17.name: Immunity
17.desc: The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from getting poisoned.

18.name: Flash Fire
18.desc: Powers up the Pokémon's Fire-type moves if it's hit by one.

19.name: Shield Dust
19.desc: This Pokémon's dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.

20.name: Own Tempo
20.desc: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

21.name: Suction Cups
21.desc: This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot to negate all moves and items that force switching out.

22.name: Intimidate
22.desc: The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entering battle, lowering their Attack stat.

23.name: Shadow Tag
23.desc: This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon's shadow to prevent it from escaping.

24.name: Rough Skin
24.desc: This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin to the attacker on contact.

25.name: Wonder Guard
25.desc: Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.

26.name: Levitate
26.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

27.name: Effect Spore
27.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on its attacker.

28.name: Synchronize
28.desc: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.

29.name: Clear Body
29.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

30.name: Natural Cure
30.desc: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.

31.name: Lightning Rod
31.desc: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.

32.name: Serene Grace
32.desc: Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring when attacking.

33.name: Swift Swim
33.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

34.name: Chlorophyll
34.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in sunshine.

35.name: Illuminate
35.desc: Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by illuminating the surroundings.

36.name: Trace
36.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon's Ability.

38.name: Poison Point
38.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

39.name: Inner Focus
39.desc: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

40.name: Magma Armor
40.desc: The Pokémon is covered with hot magma, which prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen.

41.name: Water Veil
41.desc: The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

42.name: Magnet Pull
42.desc: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using its magnetic force.

43.name: Soundproof
43.desc: Soundproofing of the Pokémon itself gives full immunity to all sound-based moves.

44.name: Rain Dish
44.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.

45.name: Sand Stream
45.desc: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.

46.name: Pressure
46.desc: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

47.name: Thick Fat
47.desc: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

48.name: Early Bird
48.desc: The Pokémon awakens twice as fast as other Pokémon from sleep.

49.name: Flame Body
49.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

50.name: Run Away
50.desc: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

51.name: Keen Eye
51.desc: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.

52.name: Hyper Cutter
52.desc: The Pokémon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

53.name: Pickup
53.desc: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

54.name: Truant
54.desc: The Pokémon can't use a move the following turn if it uses one.

55.name: Hustle
55.desc: Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.

56.name: Cute Charm
56.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.

57.name: Plus
57.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

58.name: Minus
58.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

59.name: Forecast
59.desc: The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice.

60.name: Sticky Hold
60.desc: Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.

61.name: Shed Skin
61.desc: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

62.name: Guts
62.desc: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.

63.name: Marvel Scale
63.desc: The Pokémon's marvelous scales boost the Defense stat if it has a status condition.

64.name: Liquid Ooze
64.desc: Oozed liquid has strong stench, which damages attackers using any draining move.

65.name: Overgrow
65.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

66.name: Blaze
66.desc: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

67.name: Torrent
67.desc: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

68.name: Swarm
68.desc: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

69.name: Rock Head
69.desc: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

70.name: Drought
70.desc: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.

72.name: Vital Spirit
72.desc: The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.

73.name: White Smoke
73.desc: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

74.name: Pure Power
74.desc: Using its pure power, the Pokémon doubles its Attack stat.

75.name: Shell Armor
75.desc: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

77.name: Tangled Feet
77.desc: Raises evasion if the Pokémon is confused.

78.name: Motor Drive
78.desc: Boosts its Speed stat if hit by an Electric-type move, instead of taking damage.

79.name: Rivalry
79.desc: Becomes competitive and deals more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but deals less to Pokémon of the opposite gender.

80.name: Steadfast
80.desc: The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

82.name: Gluttony
82.desc: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.

83.name: Anger Point
83.desc: The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.

84.name: Unburden
84.desc: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is used or lost.

85.name: Heatproof
85.desc: The heatproof body of the Pokémon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it.

86.name: Simple
86.desc: The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.

87.name: Dry Skin
87.desc: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in sunshine, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.

88.name: Download
88.desc: Compares an opposing Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat—whichever will be more effective.

90.name: Poison Heal
90.desc: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned, instead of losing HP.

91.name: Adaptability
91.desc: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.

92.name: Skill Link
92.desc: Maximizes the number of times multi-strike moves hit.

93.name: Hydration
93.desc: Heals status conditions if it's raining.

94.name: Solar Power
94.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat in sunny weather, but HP decreases every turn.

95.name: Quick Feet
95.desc: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon has a status condition.

96.name: Normalize
96.desc: All the Pokémon's moves become Normal type. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

97.name: Sniper
97.desc: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking.

98.name: Magic Guard
98.desc: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.

99.name: No Guard
99.desc: The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.

100.name: Stall
100.desc: The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.

101.name: Technician
101.desc: Powers up the Pokémon's weaker moves.

102.name: Leaf Guard
102.desc: Prevents status conditions in sunny weather.

103.name: Klutz
103.desc: The Pokémon can't use any held items.

104.name: Mold Breaker
104.desc: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

105.name: Super Luck
105.desc: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.

106.name: Aftermath
106.desc: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.

107.name: Anticipation
107.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

108.name: Forewarn
108.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can tell one of the moves an opposing Pokémon has.

109.name: Unaware
109.desc: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target Pokémon's stat changes.

110.name: Tinted Lens
110.desc: The Pokémon can use 'not very effective' moves to deal regular damage.

111.name: Filter
111.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

112.name: Slow Start
112.desc: For five turns, the Pokémon's Attack and Speed stats are halved.

113.name: Scrappy
113.desc: The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.

114.name: Storm Drain
114.desc: Draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit by Water-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.

115.name: Ice Body
115.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.

116.name: Solid Rock
116.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

117.name: Snow Warning
117.desc: The Pokémon summons a hailstorm when it enters a battle.

118.name: Honey Gather
118.desc: The Pokémon may gather Honey after a battle.

119.name: Frisk
119.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

120.name: Reckless
120.desc: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.

121.name: Multitype
121.desc: Changes the Pokémon's type to match the Plate or Z-Crystal it holds.

122.name: Flower Gift
122.desc: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of itself and allies when it is sunny.

123.name: Bad Dreams
123.desc: Reduces the HP of sleeping opposing Pokémon.

124.name: Pickpocket
124.desc: Steals an item from an attacker that made direct contact.

125.name: Sheer Force
125.desc: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.

126.name: Contrary
126.desc: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.

127.name: Unnerve
127.desc: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.

128.name: Defiant
128.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.

129.name: Defeatist
129.desc: Halves the Pokémon's Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP becomes half or less.

130.name: Cursed Body
130.desc: May disable a move used on the Pokémon.

131.name: Healer
131.desc: Sometimes heals an ally's status condition.

133.name: Weak Armor
133.desc: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.

136.name: Multiscale
136.desc: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes when its HP is full.

137.name: Toxic Boost
137.desc: Powers up physical attacks when the Pokémon is poisoned.

138.name: Flare Boost
138.desc: Powers up special attacks when the Pokémon is burned.

139.name: Harvest
139.desc: May create another Berry after one is used.

140.name: Telepathy
140.desc: Anticipates an ally's attack and dodges it.

141.name: Moody
141.desc: Raises one stat sharply and lowers another every turn.

142.name: Overcoat
142.desc: Protects the Pokémon from things like sand, hail, and powder.

143.name: Poison Touch
143.desc: May poison a target when the Pokémon makes contact.

144.name: Regenerator
144.desc: Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.

145.name: Big Pecks
145.desc: Protects the Pokémon from Defense-lowering effects.

146.name: Sand Rush
146.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a sandstorm.

147.name: Wonder Skin
147.desc: Makes status moves more likely to miss.

148.name: Analytic
148.desc: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.

149.name: Illusion
149.desc: Comes out disguised as the Pokémon in the party's last spot.

150.name: Imposter
150.desc: The Pokémon transforms itself into the Pokémon it's facing.

151.name: Infiltrator
151.desc: Passes through the opposing Pokémon's barrier, substitute, and the like and strikes.

152.name: Mummy
152.desc: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker's Ability to Mummy.

153.name: Moxie
153.desc: The Pokémon shows moxie, and that boosts the Attack stat after knocking out any Pokémon.

154.name: Justified
154.desc: Being hit by a Dark-type move boosts the Attack stat of the Pokémon, for justice.

155.name: Rattled
155.desc: Dark-, Ghost-, and Bug-type moves scare the Pokémon and boost its Speed stat.

156.name: Magic Bounce
156.desc: Reflects status moves, instead of getting hit by them.

157.name: Sap Sipper
157.desc: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move, instead of taking damage.

158.name: Prankster
158.desc: Gives priority to a status move.

159.name: Sand Force
159.desc: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.

160.name: Iron Barbs
160.desc: Inflicts damage to the attacker on contact with iron barbs.

161.name: Zen Mode
161.desc: Changes the Pokémon's shape when HP is half or less.

162.name: Victory Star
162.desc: Boosts the accuracy of its allies and itself.

163.name: Turboblaze
163.desc: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

164.name: Teravolt
164.desc: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

165.name: Aroma Veil
165.desc: Protects itself and its allies from attacks that limit their move choices.

166.name: Flower Veil
166.desc: Ally Grass-type Pokémon are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats.

167.name: Cheek Pouch
167.desc: Restores HP as well when the Pokémon eats a Berry.

168.name: Protean
168.desc: Changes the Pokémon's type to the type of the move it's about to use.

169.name: Fur Coat
169.desc: Halves the damage from physical moves.

170.name: Magician
170.desc: The Pokémon steals the held item of a Pokémon it hits with a move.

171.name: Bulletproof
171.desc: Protects the Pokémon from some ball and bomb moves.

172.name: Competitive
172.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered.

173.name: Strong Jaw
173.desc: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

174.name: Refrigerate
174.desc: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

175.name: Sweet Veil
175.desc: Prevents itself and ally Pokémon from falling asleep.

176.name: Stance Change
176.desc: The Pokémon changes its form to Blade Forme when it uses an attack move, and changes to Shield Forme when it uses King's Shield.

177.name: Gale Wings
177.desc: Gives priority to Flying-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is full.

178.name: Mega Launcher
178.desc: Powers up aura and pulse moves.

179.name: Grass Pelt
179.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat in Grassy Terrain.

180.name: Symbiosis
180.desc: The Pokémon passes its item to an ally that has used up an item.

181.name: Tough Claws
181.desc: Powers up moves that make direct contact.

182.name: Pixilate
182.desc: Normal-type moves become Fairy-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

183.name: Gooey
183.desc: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.

184.name: Aerilate
184.desc: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

186.name: Dark Aura
186.desc: Powers up each Pokémon's Dark-type moves.

187.name: Fairy Aura
187.desc: Powers up each Pokémon's Fairy-type moves.

188.name: Aura Break
188.desc: The effects of 'Aura' Abilities are reversed to lower the power of affected moves.

189.name: Primordial Sea
189.desc: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Fire-type attacks.

190.name: Desolate Land
190.desc: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Water-type attacks.

191.name: Delta Stream
191.desc: The Pokémon changes the weather to eliminate all of the Flying type's weaknesses.

192.name: Stamina
192.desc: Boosts the Defense stat when hit by an attack.

193.name: Wimp Out
193.desc: The Pokémon cowardly switches out when its HP becomes half or less.

194.name: Emergency Exit
194.desc: The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less.

195.name: Water Compaction
195.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat sharply when hit by a Water-type move.

196.name: Merciless
196.desc: The Pokémon's attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.

197.name: Shields Down
197.desc: When its HP becomes half or less, the Pokémon's shell breaks and it becomes aggressive.

198.name: Stakeout
198.desc: Doubles the damage dealt to the target's replacement if the target switches out.

199.name: Water Bubble
199.desc: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves done to the Pokémon and prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

201.name: Berserk
201.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to become half or less.

202.name: Slush Rush
202.desc: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a hailstorm.

203.name: Long Reach
203.desc: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.

204.name: Liquid Voice
204.desc: All sound-based moves become Water-type moves.

205.name: Triage
205.desc: Gives priority to a healing move.

206.name: Galvanize
206.desc: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

207.name: Surge Surfer
207.desc: Doubles the Pokémon's Speed stat on Electric Terrain.

208.name: Schooling
208.desc: When it has a lot of HP, the Pokémon forms a powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP is low.

209.name: Disguise
209.desc: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokémon can protect it from an attack.

210.name: Battle Bond
210.desc: Defeating an opposing Pokémon strengthens the Pokémon's bond with its Trainer, and it becomes Ash-Greninja. Water Shuriken gets more powerful.

211.name: Power Construct
211.desc: Other Cells gather to aid when its HP becomes half or less. Then the Pokémon changes its form to Complete Forme.

212.name: Corrosion
212.desc: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it's a Steel or Poison type.

213.name: Comatose
213.desc: It's always drowsing and will never wake up. It can attack without waking up.

214.name: Queenly Majesty
214.desc: Its majesty pressures the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.

215.name: Innards Out
215.desc: Damages the attacker landing the finishing hit by the amount equal to its last HP.

216.name: Dancer
216.desc: When another Pokémon uses a dance move, it can use a dance move following it regardless of its Speed.

217.name: Battery
217.desc: Powers up ally Pokémon's special moves.

218.name: Fluffy
218.desc: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

219.name: Dazzling
219.desc: Surprises the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.

220.name: Soul Heart
220.desc: Boosts its Sp. Atk stat every time a Pokémon faints.

221.name: Tangling Hair
221.desc: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.

222.name: Receiver
222.desc: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

223.name: Power of Alchemy
223.desc: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

224.name: Beast Boost
224.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

225.name: RKS System
225.desc: Changes the Pokémon's type to match the memory disc it holds.

226.name: Electric Surge
226.desc: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

227.name: Psychic Surge
227.desc: Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

228.name: Misty Surge
228.desc: Turns the ground into Misty Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

229.name: Grassy Surge
229.desc: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

230.name: Full Metal Body
230.desc: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

231.name: Shadow Shield
231.desc: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.

232.name: Prism Armor
232.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

233.name: Neuroforce
233.desc: Powers up moves that are super effective.
